{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19805v1", "title": "On virtual chirality of 3-manifolds", "summary": "We prove that if a prime 3-manifold M is not finitely covered by the 3-sphere
or a product manifold, then M is virtually chiral, i.e. it has a finite cover
that does not admit an orientation reversing self-homeomorphism. In general if
a 3-manifold contains a virtually chiral prime summand, then it is virtually
chiral.", "main_category": "math.GT", "categories": "math.GT", "published": "2025-04-28T13:56:01Z"}
